title: Former head of Colombian army charged in killings of 130 civilians
description: Former Gen. Mario Montoya is the highest-ranking official yet charged by Colombia’s Special Jurisdiction for Peace in the false positives scandal.

title: Two years after U.S. withdrawal, Afghan refugees wait for asylum
description: The temporary nature of humanitarian parole means that Afghan nationals who arrived as a part of Operation Allies Welcome live in uncertainty about their future.

title: Drone strikes hit military aircraft deep inside Russia
description: Combat drones hit a Russian civilian and military airport in Pskov, in northwest Russia, damaging several aircraft and raising questions about Moscow’s air defenses.

title: Map shows seven military coups in sub-Saharan Africa over two years
description: The military coup against Gabon’s long-ruling president, Ali Bongo, comes amid political upheaval across sub-Saharan Africa.

title: U.S. engages in frank talks amid warnings China has become ‘uninvestible’
description: For all the public smiles on both sides — including a surprisingly long meeting with China’s premier — one word hung over Raimondo’s four-day trip: “Uninvestible.”

title: Canada warns LGBTQ people of U.S. state laws in updated travel advisory
description: Ottawa’s advice for travelers to check local laws in the U.S. comes amid a surge in state legislation targeting LGBTQ rights this year.

title: Gabon army officers announce seizure of power after presidential vote
description: Around a dozen officers appeared on state television to announce they were overturning President Ali Bongo’s third election win and suspending state institutions.

title: Putin struggles with falling ruble, rising prices as sanctions bite
description: Rising prices caused by a drop in the value of the ruble are bringing Russia’s war — and the impact of sanctions — home to many Russians for the first time.

title: Ukraine live briefing: At least 2 dead in strikes on Kyiv following attack on Russian military airfield
description: A Ukrainian official called the strikes the most powerful assault on the capital since spring. They came amid several drone attacks in Russia.

title: Sudan’s war has no end in sight, as atrocities and abuses mount
description: The battle between Sudan’s army and a paramilitary group marks an old-school clash between rival warlords, squabbling for turf and power. And they have devastated the nation of 46 million people.
